subject: Communication
title: Uncertainty Avoidance: Comfort with Ambiguity
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Uncertainty Avoidance: Comfort with Ambiguity.

hook.text: German trains run on the second. Brazilian parties start 'whenever.

buildup.text: Uncertainty avoidance measures a culture's tolerance for ambiguity, risk, and unstructured situations.

discovery.text: High UA cultures (Japan, Greece, France) create detailed rules and plans.

twist.text: High UA isn't about avoiding risk. It's about controlling risk through structure.

climax.text: Mismatched UA in global teams causes friction: one side wants detailed plans; the other wants to 'figure it out as we.

punchline.text: Some cultures plan the adventure. Others adventure into the plan.

quiz.question: What does high uncertainty avoidance indicate in a culture?
